channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.description:
Two drains full of leaves

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Babbacombe Road, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Disabled parking space is blocked by items that have been dumped in carpark at rear of 18 Crimscott Street. Vehicle access from Page Street., 17th July
item.description:
Disabled parking space is blocked by items that have been dumped in carpark at rear of 18 Crimscott Street. Vehicle access from Page Street. Foot access from Crimscott and Page Street. Items dumped include; the seating part on a sofa, small book shelf & small pieces of wood. People have been seen sitting on sofa drinking & taking drugs. Various items of litter also left behind. This rubbish is blocking one part of only two disabled bays for 18 Crimscott Street. It is a quite location out of view from the main roads, hence why people go to this location to use it. Please can the furniture and litter be cleaned up?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Grange Road, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Road markings need re-painting, 17th July
item.description:
The road markings here have faded, as a result, people are going straight ahead in the right only lane and causing congestion (you then get three lanes of traffic instead of two going into one as the lane merges ahead into East Road).

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): New North Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Low hanging tree, 17th July
item.description:
I rpeorted this low hanging tree last year but nothing was done, it is in the gardens of Baring Court which apparently belongs to Islington Council. The branch is too low for the buses that pass and they are hitting the tree, you can see in the picture chunks missing and red paint. Please can this tree be cut back?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Baring Street, Islington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish, 17th July
item.description:
Lots of rubbish. I think the station staff have our a plastic sack there and it has overspill. There is a pushchair dumped, too. Graffiti on the fence. The whole area is really dirty and messy. A garden was placed many years ago, nothing is done with it. People just sit on the wooden fence. Lots of cigarette ends.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Whitehall Lane, North End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sunken manhole cover, 17th July
item.description:
This sunken manhole cover / pothole is right in the bus stop D, and it's impossble to avoid when serving the stop - it is very unconfrotable for passengers and risks damaging the bus tyres if it can be resurfaced please. it's been there about 6 weeks according to drivers and also is prone to flooding.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A10, West Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Continual running water from fountain, 17th July
item.description:
The fountain is leaking and there is a constant stream of water running down the hill. This is wasting a lot of water during a drought.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crookston Road, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet
